text: The Upnor Formation is a geological formation found in the London Basin of southeastern England.Upnor Formation at Fossilworks.org It is of Thanetian (Upper Paleocene) age. It lies unconformably on the Thanet Formation for most of its outcrop, but in the west it lies directly on Chalk Group. It is generally overlain either by the Reading Formation or the Woolwich Formation, but locally in north and east Kent it is overlain unconformably by the Harwich Formation. It forms the lowermost part of the Lambeth Group. The type section is at Lower Upnor Pit, north Kent. The formation has provided fossils of the eutherian mammal Arctocyonides arenae.Hooker & Millbank, 2001 == References == === Bibliography === * Category:Geologic formations of England Category:Paleocene Series of Europe Category:Paleogene England Category:Thanetian Stage Category:Sandstone formations Category:Shallow marine deposits Category:Paleontology in England Category:Geology of London
title: Upnor Formation
